result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Neglecting a Child (Specified Harm Did Not Occur)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melissa Gibson

records.addlTxt: Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with AJK pursuant to DMCPS discretion, or Children's Court TPC/Dispositional Order (whichever is superseding). If DMCPS closes out their investigation and Children's Court has no open orders, this order is to convert into a No Violent Contact Order.

Defendant Melissa Gibson in court.  Prosecuting attorney Kylan Reilly in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Skwierawski, Branch 41. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  

The case is adjourned to Br. 41 for a Pretrial Conference.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Melissa Gibson
Current: 3553 N Oakland Ave, Shorewood, WI 53211 United States  (Effective: 10-25-2022)
Prior: 8916 West National Aveue ,#18, West Allis, WI 53227

The Milwaukee County Sheriff's Office has cleared the active warrant, provided the next court date to the defendant, and requested the warrant be withdrawn with approval of Deputy Chief Judge Carl Ashley. MCSO advised defendant to appear in Room 221 of the Safety Building, in person, at 1:00 PM on 10-25-2022.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Melissa Gibson not in court.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
